result.execSummary:
The defendant Anthony Marice Maxwell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges. As to all costs and surcharges, amounts to be paid during the period of probation, or if not paid, a civil judgment is ordered. Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.

Follow through with mental health treatment and take prescribed medications.
Maintain absolute sobriety.
All other terms and conditions deemed appropriate by the probation department.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Marice Maxwell

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: Defendant Anthony Marice Maxwell in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to NO CONTEST as to COUNT 2. On motion of the State, Court orders COUNT 1 dismissed and read-in. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. (Amended) Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor. Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI with recommendation was ordered on motion of defense.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Marice Maxwell in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for plea and sentencing hearing today. Court is in trial and unable to conduct hearing today.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 16, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Marice Maxwell in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 09-15-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Marice Maxwell in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court will not accept defendant's plea at this time. Case adjourned for plea and sentencing.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for 07-21-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Anthony Marice Maxwell in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 05-29-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Marice Maxwell in court with attorney Michael s Winter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-14-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Marice Maxwell in court with attorney Michael S. Winter.  Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea in Branch 7.  Plea hearing scheduled for 04-02-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Anthony Marice Maxwell in court with attorney Michael S. Winter.  Nicole Sheldon for Denis John Stingl appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered Defendant not to be in possession of any weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with the Wal-Mart located at 6300 W. Brown Deer Road, in the Village of Brown Deer, Milwaukee County, Wisconsin.

Defendant Anthony Marice Maxwell in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7. Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold Defendant for further proceedings.  Defendant pleds not guilty as to Count 1. DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.   Case is adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/23/15 @ 1:30pm
